Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class ObjectMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.ObjectMethods
  • public class ObjectMethods
extends Object
    General methods applicable to objects of any type.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty​(Object obj)
        Returns whether or not the provided object is empty. Returns true if the object:
        • is null
        • or an empty String
        • or an empty Collection
        • or an empty Map
        • or a zero-length array
        • or a zero-size Sizeable
        • or an empty Emptyable
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:

      • notEmpty

        public static boolean notEmpty​(Object obj)
        Returns the reverse of isEmpty.
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:

      • notNullRecursive

        public static boolean notNullRecursive​(Object obj)
        Returns true if the provided object is not null and, if it is an array or Collection, none of its elements are null. Otherwise this method returns false.
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:

      • notEmptyRecursive

        public static boolean notEmptyRecursive​(Object obj)

        Parameters:

      • e2nEquals

        public static <T> boolean e2nEquals​(T obj1,
                                    T obj2)
        Tests the provided objects for equality using empty-equals-null semantics. The following applies:
        1. null equals an empty String
        2. null equals an empty List
        3. null equals an empty Set
        4. null equals an empty Map
        5. null equals a zero-length array
        6. null equals an empty Emptyable
        7. null equals a zero-size Sizeable
        8. An empty/zero-length String, List, Set, Map, array, Emptyable and Sizeable are not equal to each other
        9. For any other pair of objects this method returns the result of Objects.equals
        Parameters:
        obj1 -
        obj2 -
        Returns:

      • e2nEqualsRecursive

        public static <T> boolean e2nEqualsRecursive​(T obj1,
                                             T obj2)
        Recursively tests the provided objects for equality using empty-equals-null semantics. In other words, if the provided arguments are non-empty arrays, lists or sets, their elements are also compared using e2nEqualsRecursive. If the provided arguments are non-empty maps, then keys are compared normally (using equals) while values are compared using e2nEqualsRecursive.
        Parameters:
        obj1 -
        obj2 -
        Returns:

      • e2nHashCode

        public static int e2nHashCode​(Object obj)
        Generates a hash code for the provided object using using empty-equals-null semantics. That is: null and empty objects (as per ObjectMethods.isEmpty) all have hash code zero. The hash code is not calculated recursively for arrays and Collection objects. Therefore maps and sets relying on empty-equals-null semantics to find keys and elements will likely have to fall back more often on e2nEquals or e2nEqualsRecursive.
        Parameters:
        obj -
        Returns:

      • e2nHash

        public static int e2nHash​(Object... objs)
        Generates a hash code for the provided arguments using using empty-equals-null semantics. See Object.hashCode().
        Parameters:
        objs -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        StringMethods.isEmpty(Object), ArrayMethods.isEmpty(Object), CollectionMethods.isEmpty(Collection)
